faq.name: whatis_exult
faq.question: What is ?

answer.para: Ultima 7, an RPG from the early 1990's, still has a huge following. But, being a DOS game with a very non-standard memory manager, it is difficult to run it on the latest computers. is a project to create an Ultima 7 game engine that runs on modern operating systems, capable of using the data and graphics files that come with the game.

is being developed in C++ under Linux, MacOS and Windows using the SDL library to make porting to other platforms relatively easy. The current version supports much of the game's plot, allowing you to talk to NPCs, use items, solve quests, and even fight monsters. Music, speech, and the full introduction are also implemented. This, and further development, is only possible due to the work done by other fans who have decoded the various Ultima 7 data files, especially Gary Thompson, Maxim Shatskih, Jakob Shonberg, and Wouter Dijkslag.

aims to let those people who own Ultima 7 (copyright 1993) play the game on modern hardware, in as close to (or perhaps even surpassing) its original splendor as is possible. You need to own "Ultima 7: The Black Gate" in order to use , and we encourage you to buy a legal copy.

faq.name: why_name_exult
faq.question: Why is it called - what is the meaning of this name?

answer.cite: I originally wrote it [Exult] solely for X-windows, so that's where the 'X' comes from. The "ult", of course, comes from Ultima. It was only about 6 months ago [02/29/2000] that I replaced the X code with SDL, which is multiplatform. Then Arthuris ported it to Win32 (and to BeOS). He had also ported the earlier version, but it was much harder to maintain that way.
I'd like to point out that "exult" is also an English verb that means "to rejoice, to exhibit great happiness".

faq.name: is_exult_free
faq.question: Is free ?

answer.para:
is more than free: it's Free (notice the caps). is released under the GNU GPL (General Public License). This means that the source code for is freely available and you can do whatever you want with it. However, if you make modifications to any of 's components and publicly redistribute your work you are required to make the source freely available in turn. Obviously the team would be very grateful if any modifications you make are contributed back to the main code, so that everyone can benefit from them. If you want to work on just send an e-mail to the team.
More information on the GNU GPL at .

faq.name: compile_linux_snapshot
faq.question: How do I compile a source code snapshot under Linux?

ol.li: Install the latest version of SDL ()

Extract the source code archive to ~/exult:
unzip exult.zip -d ~
Create a fresh install of U7. I'll assume that you've installed U7 in ~/ultima7

Run autogen.sh to create a configure script, then compile :
cd ~/exult; chmod u+x autogen.sh; ./autogen.sh; ./configure; make

Install and the data file:
cp exult ~/ultima7; mkdir ~/ultima7/data; cp ./data/exult.flx ~/ultima7/data

faq.name: exult_config
faq.question: What is it with the exult.cfg file?

answer.para: Most of the switches in the exult.cfg file are now handled via "Setup" when you start up . For further understanding read the following descriptions.
answer.cite: The file uses a simple hierarchical XML-like syntax, which should be simple to understand and modify. Take care though. Handling of syntax errors in this file is not well tested. Exult will create this file for you, with some sensible defaults, and you can then edit it to suit your preferences.
answer.para: Okay, the default file looks like this (do not copy the **and following - these are my remarks).
Note: yes means enabled, no means disabled

configdesc.line: (default) **configure custom keybindings or leave the (default) - see
no **enable/disable usecode-tracing for debuging (you shouldn't need this one)
no **this skips the intro in BG when you started a new game; Iolo talks to Peter, the Avatar appears, Iolo talks to you, the mayor talks to you and so on.
no **this skips the splash screen, the intro before you get to the game menu, disabling it brings you straight to the game menu
yes **enable/disable all audio - this takes precedence over the other audio settings (you can change this in game via Esc - the setting is saved)
yes **enable/disable sound effects (you can change this in game via Esc - the setting is saved)
yes **enable/disable MIDI effects (you can change this in game via Esc - the setting is saved)
gm **you can choose between "gm","gs","gs127" and "none" - try out which sounds best for you
1.000000 **set volume (kind of at least, best don't change)
yes **enable/disable speech (you can change this in game via Esc - the setting is saved)
320 **here you choose your resolution, it can be as big as your monitor allows. 320x200 is the resolution of the original - see for issues with this setting.
yes **do you want to play fullscreen?
no **"no" enables fading between different menu points
SuperEagle **choose different scalers here: SuperEagle, 2xSaI, bilinear, point, interlaced - see
<gamma> **set gamma levels to adjust brightness, same as +/- in game

faq.name: path_config
faq.question: What do I have to change in the Path-Settings?

answer.para: You have two choices on how to setup .

The first one is very easy, just extract all the files from the compiled snapshot archive to the directory where you have The Black Gate or Serpent Isle installed. Concerning the paths you don't have to configure anything.

The other is a little more complicated but appeals to control freaks like me:
Make a directory c:\ultima7
make two subfolders named "blackgate" and "serpentisle" (without the quotes of course)
Extract or install the two Ultima 7 games into the appropiate folder ("The Black Gate" to c:\ultima7\blackgate and "Serpent Isle" to c:\ultima7\serpentisle)
Extract the compiled to c:\ultima7
Now you have to edit the exult.cfg file like this:
You can either use the relative (./blackgate) or absolute (c:\ultima\blackgate) path to point to the correct directory.
Word of advice: Don't copy the files from the one game into the directory of the other.

faq.name: sound_available

Yes. Music plays via MIDI and sounds quite like the original. Sound effects either play via digital (.wav) sfx. Even speech is supported.
You can change the way the music and the sound effects play via the setup menu or the exult.cfg file.

faq.name: wave_sfx
faq.question: How do I enable to play digital wave sfx?

answer.para: You have to set a path to the sfx pack in the waves settings in exult.cfg (see ). You have to download seperate packs for each game as order of the sfx in BG and SI varies a bit and otherwise will sound odd. However there is a little issue with sfx playback in SI (see ).
Note that configuring your soundfonts is not needed for digital wave sfx.

The sfx pack made by Joseph Morris can be found at (~4.55 MB) for "The Black Gate" and (~6.01 MB) for "Serpent Isle". He recorded the original 114 sfx used in Black Gate which must have been a lot of work. If your soundcard doesn't support soundfonts this pack is a "must-have". Enjoy!

faq.name: scaler
faq.question: What does the Scale option mean?

answer.para: By default runs at 320x200 (which is the resolution the original Ultima VII used). uses different scaling engines to double the size to 640x400 and increase the quality of the graphics. More information on the excellent scaling engine by Derek Liauw is available at . The scalers also work with higher resolutions. To change the scaling method either use the menu or change your exult.cfg - see . "2xSaI" is the new scaler, "bilinear" is the old one, "point" duplicates the pixels, "interlaced" is the same as "point" except misses every other line, "SuperEagle" is another scaler by Derek (the author of 2xSaI). Try them out to see how they look and which you like best.
Your screen should be set to 16-bit color mode.
Within the game you can use the Alt + and Alt - to switch resolution. The game will save the last selected mode and reuse it the next time you run .
See for issues with scalers and resolutions.

faq.name: case_sensitiveness
faq.question: Is case sensitive?

answer.para: Case sensitiveness is a slight problem with when you are not using the Windows port. tries lower and uppercase versions, and reports the error after trying the last (ie. uppercase) filename. If the "static" directory and the files within are uppercase you might run into problems. Better make sure that all these are lowercase. When unzipping the Ultima files from a zip in Linux you can set it to extract in lowercase with the "-L" switch (e.g. 'unzip -L ultima7.zip'). This is fixed in the latest release.

faq.name: exult_keys
faq.question: What are the keys used in ?

answer.para: Starting with V0.91 Alpha2 all key commands can be changed. However, there is a default setting which closely follows the original with the addition of some improvements.

To change your key bindings first edit the file defaultkeys.txt in your directory, change the bindings and save the file (e.g. as my_keys.txt). Now you have to change exult.cfg to use that file. You can even choose if you want to change your key bindings for BG or SI. See the keys settings at . Change (default) to my_keys.txt.
During the game press h to see a help screen with all the keys (for MacOS change Alt for Cmd - the in-game help screen shows the correct key combination for MacOS).

faq.name: bg_improvements
faq.question: Serpent Isle had many more improvements over Black Gate (keyring, better paperdoll...). Will these be implemented?

answer.para: Right now the main goal is to get the Black Gate 100% working. After that it could be that some more things will be improved as far as it is possible to implement these.
The keyring is not in Black Gate but there is the k key which tries all the keys in the inventory to open a lock.

Recently Ryan added paperdoll support in Black Gate. Though it is still buggy (some items disappear to Neverneverland) it is beautiful to look at. Very impressive. For this you need to have Serpent Isle installed on your hard drive and you must set the path to it in exult.cfg (see ). If an item seems to have disappeared press F2 to activate the cheat menu and disable Paperdolls. Now you should find that missing item in your inventory.

faq.name: other_improvements
faq.question: Any other improvements/features?

answer.para: Since the Alpha 4 release a new game menu was added with an improved sound settings box and a very much improved (awesome) savegame box. This allows you much more savegames than the original (you should run out of disc space before you run out of savegame slots), shows a screenshot of the location you saved at, the members of your party, your stats, game time and the date you actually saved. The game menu is opened via Esc and the save game box is opened either via the game menu or the s key.
In , you can still move your party even if there is a box/body/stats open/on. In the original, the world was kind of frozen. Now it is only frozen if you hit the t or s key.

faq.name: disable_improvements
faq.question: How do I disable all improvements?

answer.para: To get an Ultima 7 that looks and behaves as close to the original as possible there are several things to do (though I wonder why you'd want to do that):

ul.li: make custom keybindings files (see ) in which you disable all the keys that were not in the original for Black Gate and Serpents Isle. Since the Alpha 4 release you have to assign s to old_file_gump to enable the old savegame menu (the line in your custom keybindings file should look like: S old_file_gump)
Edit the exult.cfg file to point to those custom keys.

Don't set the path to the Serpent Isle files (see ) and put SI and a second copy of in a seperate directory (note: you can no longer launch both BG and SI from the same exult.exe). This disables SI paperdolls in BG.
Alternatively you can leave the cheat menu binding in the keybindings file (F2) and disable "Paperdolls" each time you run .
Edit the exult.cfg to use the resolution of 320x200, to run in full screen and disable scalers.
The disc icon in the Avatar paperdoll opens the new game menu. As of now this cannot be altered. Sorry!

faq.question: What is it?

answer.para: is a map-editor for , allowing you to modify the map of a game and, eventually, to create a completely new landscape for a new game.

faq.name: cool_name
faq.question: Who came up with the cool name?

answer.para: Tristan

faq.name: need_to_run
faq.question: What do you need to run it?

answer.para: Currently, you need to be running on X (Linux, Unix, etc.), with set to run in a window (not fullscreen). You also need the GTK+ library installed.

faq.name: port_platforms
faq.question: When will it be ported to other platforms?

answer.para: That depends on when someone volunteers to do the work :-) There are three issues:

ul.li: GTK has to be ported to the platform. I think this is already true for Win32.
uses sockets to communicate with . This also shouldn't be a problem for Win32.
X drag-n-drop is used to put new objects on the landscape. The 'drop' part of this will have to be rewritten for Win32 , OR, drag-n-drop could be an enhancement to SDL someday.

faq.name: how_to_run
faq.question: How do you run it?

answer.para: You can run all by itself, but it isn't useful that way, as it uses as a server. What you really want to do is:

ul.li: Put 'exult_studio.glade' in the 'data' directory.
Be sure 'exult_studio' is in your path.
Run .
Press 'alt-ctrl-m' to go into 'map-editor' mode. If all is set up correctly, exult_studio will start up, and will have a list of files on the left side of its window.

answer.para: You can also start up one or the other separately, and they'll reconnect:

ul.li: If isn't running, start it up. Then, in , use the 'File' menu to choose the static directory (for the game you're playing).
If isn't running start it up with: exult_studio -x (path to dir containing exult_studio.glade) -d (path to game directory)

faq.name: what_can_do_at_moment
faq.question: What can you do at the moment?

ul.li: You can browse shapes in the main window.

You can drag a shape from the shape browser to , and that object will be placed in the game. (Note: Not all such objects are saved with the game yet; saving things like buildings will be implemented soon.)
You can edit an 'egg' by double-clicking on it. An edit box should appear.
You can create a new 'egg' using the pull-down menu in . In the Egg edit box, after you hit 'Apply', you'll be prompted to click in where you want the egg to appear.
If editing a 'monster' egg, you can set the monster by dragging the shape from the browser to the area that displays the monster.

faq.name: what_next
faq.question: What's next?

answer.para: The next things to be implemented are:

ul.li: An NPC editor, similar to the one for Eggs (but with lots more stuff to set).
A simple object editor, that lets you modify an object's 'quality', 'quantity' and flags.
A 'save-map' function in to save the whole map (not just the moveable objects that 'save-game' stores).

faq.name: client_server_stuff
faq.question: What's with this client/server stuff?

answer.para: A map-editor needs to provide the ability to display the game, place objects on the map, and move objects around. That functionality is already in , and it makes sense to reuse it. So we could have made a part of . However, is already a huge program, and is getting unwieldy to work on.
With this architecture, can have all the messy code for displaying/editing dialog boxes, while only needs a little bit of work to handle requests.
Also, I (Jeff) wanted to get a little experience programming with sockets:-)

faq.name: known_issues
faq.question: Known Issues

ul.li: Movement is sometimes jerky or slow.
We don't know what all the data in 'weapons.dat' and 'ammo.dat' means, so hit points and damage don't work as well as in the original game.
Sound effects in SI are sometimes odd with the wave pack as some sounds were coded in to correspond to the sfx number in BG. This is a bug and will be addressed in due time.

In Fellowship meetings some NPCs appear not to attend these though they should and sometimes even speak there. This is due to a bug in which makes NPCs sit on already taken seats and only the top most NPC can be seen. Moving the top most via Hackmover makes the others visible.
If you run a resolution higher than the original (320x200) some NPCs that are further away from the Avatar may seem to disappear and reappear when you get away or closer to them.
With scalers enabled you might encounter slow downs of the game. The team is working on this right now and it is already a lot faster.
The speech in the intro is out of synch with the lips animations. But now it matches the speed of the text.
There are reported problems with digital sound effects or speech when using Vortex series sound cards under Win9x/ME. It's not sure if this is a driver or issue.
